review: Waiting time sucked, we called ahead it said 22 minuets we got there in 20 minuets still had to wait 37 more. There were 10 or more tables open, so I asked the young lady why aren't we sitting she replied the "guy" has to assign the seats which I replied I been here 35 minuets and I have seen the freakin "guy" yet. We finally got seated. The waitress greeted us pretty fast  The food was ok The waitress was pretty good  Over all was ok

Best ribs on Long Island  The 2 for $22 dinner is a great value.  The salad is fresh & large Chili's is only place I go for ribs.  I have been going there for the last 20years  Vanessa at the bar is terrific she makes dinning at Chili's a great

Went here today before class. My server was generally nice. She kept the conversation short and just took my order(I already knew what I wanted anyway) food came out quickly and it was okay.  It's really quiet during lunchtime so I assume that's why I was serviced so promptly. Come here from 11-4 to get the lunch special deals!  My salad was great, but the lettuce tasted kind of metallic ( if that makes sense). The margarita flatbread is my absolute favorite because of the aioli that's drizzled on top.  Generally it was a typical corporate restaurant experience, nothing really special though.

Came with a party of 6; 4 adults and 2 kiddies, Around 10pm last night. The server was efficient and friendly, especially with the kids. Food and drinks came fast and were pretty yummy. Chili's had twofers, I'm all in there with the mango and blackberry margaritas. Haha. The table had; steak nachos, fajitas, chipotle ribs which were all pretty good. My brother loves a good burger but he wasn't crazy about their Old Fashion burger. One kid liked his Mac and cheese but my godson didn't like his Popcorn chicken looking meal, he said it was too dry (it was).  Another server was cleaning around and was kind of rude and gave us a non working mini kiosk thing that you can play games and pay the bill with. Overall, our server was efficient, kind, patient and attentive.

I have not been to Chili's in years but we popped in here for a quick snack before a movie. Well anyway, since a salad of some sort was on my mind I ordered this tex-mex bowl of sorts with chicken. When it arrived all I could think of was what is this????? This is the ugliest most unappealing bowl of I dont know what the hell I ordered.  I was able to see the avocado, there was a slice of chicken, a smear of sour cream, tortilla chips (maybe), corn, lettuce, cheese...and I dont know what else was thrown...and I do mean thrown in the bowl.  Someone in the back just must have been grabbing a little bit of everything and said oh that looks texmexy. If I had been making this dish at home I would have called it refrigerator buffet salad. Open the fridge throw it in a bowl...close the door and eat it.  Time being short, I did eat this gastronomic excursion with hopes I would not get sick. It was ok/tolerable. I will wait another 10 years before my next visit to Chili's.  The end.

Food is good .. the freaking people are awesome here.. that's why the five stars.. but the food is damn good too tho..  Ryan our waiter is a spot on host..knows his stuff and works magic with the customers..

I've been to this Chili's many times now. It's always crowded here so there's always a long wait to get seated. Luckily last time we found a high table by the bar area, so we didn't have to wait long. I ordered the Prime Rib Fresh Mex Bowl, and I have to admit, it was better than I expected. I didn't think that I would like the prime rib with the avocado, but everything went together well. I also had the steak here once, but I didn't like it, so I wouldn't recommend it. However, I definitely recommend the Molten Chocolate Cake if you order dessert.

I came here with my family. The waitress was very nice and the prices were good. They have the 2 for 22 and the margaritas were buy one get one free. My steakhouse combo was very good. The oreo dessert was good. I was very happy with my experience.
I usually like Chilis. This location is usually a sold 4 star but this time wasn't the best.

I normally don't go to large chain restaurants and chili's reminded me why! The waiter and service was decent, the restaurant wasn't crowded and there wasn't a wait at all. But the food was another story.  When the food arrived it was unbelievable, everything was cold. Three of the six dishes we ordered came too cold to eat, and we had to wait until they waiter brought out new dishes. I've never been to chili's and got served fajitas that wasn't sizzling, in face this time I think my fajitas was still frozen! To top it off the brought out the dessert without spoons, and by the times the spoons arrived the ice cream already melted. If only my food was as hot as the dessert.  The waiter promised the manager would stop by, and he never did. I guess we weren't important enough. Between the cold food and the cold manager, I would never eat here again.

I really love the honey BBQ chicken crispers and the margaritas. I think the fact that they have all day 2 fers really makes them a better value than Applebee's or Friday's.  They lost a star because the bar is made of a weird material that feels DISGUSTING. It's sticky and feels moist. It's porous so it feels like it absorbs dirt and grime. Ew. Don't sit here. Also the water from this location tastes nasty. I'm an avid 5 bottles of water a day gal so when I order water anywhere I can sense a dirty ice maker. This place has the oddest tasting water ice had in a loooong time. I refuse to drink it.
Wonderful, welcoming and quick service! The food was great and the waiters were all very friendly.

First time here and will absolutely be back! Would've been 5 stars but tyranny appetizers came out kinda cold but good, the waitress was awesome! Soon as we'd get about 1/2 way on our drinks, she was there with refills, the food was awesome! I ordered the old fashioned cheese burger and it was yummy, the wife had a ribeye and it was cooked perfect! The endless nacho appetizer was seriously good, the boneless wings were kinda cold but they were good, needed a little more kick on the buffalo sauce, the winner in our dinner was the mango tea, I need them to sell this by the gallon! It was sooooo good! All in all is was great! If you do happen to hit up Chili's, the mango tea is like crack addictive!, next time I'm gonna do the smoked platter, I went with the burger cause the commercial I saw made the burger look like a monster! It is a MONSTER! Can't wait to go back!

My first time eating at Chili's because I was deathly afraid of the huge Chili on the outside since I was younger. Not quite sure if my phobia had a name, I just knew it was real. Some colleagues wanted to grab a quick bite for dinner. the food was pretty fair, I ordered a salad, that left quite a bit to be desired but then again it was a salad (lol). The chocolate lava cake rendition was pretty amazing! I would totally come back for desert any day!

As far as the service,cleanliness and food quality this place is much improved!, Obviously they heard us!kudos to corporate & management for listening! I left off 1 star because the drinks are completely watered down and/or they use a stupid measurement system to save on the alcohol usage, probably why it's 2 for 1 But i digress,it just needs to change , regardless we will be back!

I havent been to a chilis in several years- but recently went to check this one out. They had a great deal- a three course meal for $10. I had a salad, half rack baby back ribs and a molten chocolate cake (which was insanely good).. all for $10! Cant beat that price anywhere. Agreed the place should be a bit cleaner- but its your typical chain restaurant

I don't normally go on rants but this was a horrible experience for me and my friends when we came here for a bite to eat. The server was horrendous, it took about an hour for us to get served after he kept passing us by and ignoring us after I went about calling for his assistance multiple times. And it took another hour for us to get our food and drinks, which already offset how upset I was at the terrible service. And again after we ate and was ready for the check it was terrible. I don't know if this is a normal thing for this area or Chili's but I'm livid at the experience I had here. And while we are waiting for our food he had the nerve to sit down at a table near us and talk with his friends, they were cursing and being very loud instead of checking on our food items which was beyond disrespectful and because of this I don't think I will go to chilis again, told all my foodie and critic friends about this and they were astonished about what happened to me and my friends here. Tried to talk to the manager but he wasn't coming out from the back to talk to us. The food wasn't hot and we just had a terrible time, that is not a way to run a business nor treat paying customers.

Salmon was good. Service was pleasant But the young lady who served us. Had long flowing black hair!!  I really don't want to be served my food by a person whose hair is cascading all over with my food in her hands!! I thought servers were suppose to have there hair tied back for sanitary reasons  I won't be back. Calling board of health

Looks like a nice place to eat, in  long Island, my friends from Brooklyn brought me here to make me feel better..enjoying a Patron Margaritas with Nachos were  good, the food is ok..looks like the end of the night left overs not to fresh...but it's OK for someone who is hungry, we got the $35 special, for that price at this time of night..over rated, I might try it again, but only the nachos, the guacamole was a lil stale...be careful with the restrooms, it look like a hurricane went by...and that was about 5 years ago. (Clean it up).

Ewww. Overly salty, oily, yuck chain food. Not a fan. I had asparagus fries and they were so soggy bc of all the oil. Chicken and steak fajita was salty, and nothing special at all. I wish I went somewhere else for lunch. There are plenty of other restaurants in the area that would've been far better than this.  Looked and felt dirty everywhere. Servers weren't too friendly and we waited forever for our drinks. Margarita sucked.  They have touch screens at each table and you can pay your bill by credit card this was. Nice concept but imagine how dirty those things are?! Yuck!

The service was incredibly attentive & friendly all around. When I walked in, a server from a table near by walked over to welcome me, say hello & ask how I was doing. The bartender was helpful in helping me decide what I wanted to order according to what I told her I was craving. The lady who brought me my food was cheerful & happy. My order came out perfect & the fries were fresh out of the fryer/piping hot which was more than I could have hoped for. & the bartender was available & attentive when I need salt & pepper as well as when my drink was getting low.  My experience overall could not have been more perfect. I am so happy I decided to come in for dinner and look forward to the next time I come in soon :)

This place is ridiculous. The manager is a completely rude and unprofessional. She's rude and has an attitude problem. They messed up our to go order TWO SEPARATE TIMES. When I called to speak to a manger and try to correct it, she insisted I was wrong as SHE was the one who packed the order so it MUST have been right. She would rather argue with me instead of just trying to make the situation right. Her attitude was just spilling through the phone. We will never order nor eat at this location again.

This was my first time here so my expectations weren't that high. We had the steak and shrimp combo fajita, and it was pretty good- the shrimp was very tender and although I didn't try the steak, everyone else said it was great. However the ribs- we got a full rack- was very dry and not as hot as expected. They also had a very weird flavor. But our server was very friendly and outgoing.

Y'all can call me crazy if you want - but I love Chili's!  I really do.  And right now I'm craving their buffalo chicken salad... I'm pretty sure I could live off of this salad.  All the necessary food groups are there: chicken, bacon, bleu cheese crumbles, and pico de gallo over a giant bed of lettuce.  Yum!  I do recommend skipping the ranch dressing that comes with and try the honey-lime vinagrette, its so good and keeps the salad feeling a little lighter. Hubs and I had stopped in not too long ago for an early dinner (around 4pm).  The place was half empty so we were seated right away.  Our waiter was seriously the nicest kid, a little goofy, but so nice!  We never had to ask for refills - this kid had it covered.  He even sent us home with giant to-go cups of mango iced tea. To balance our leafy salads we ordered up the Skillet Queso for an app.  The haters can say whatever they want - the skillet queso is amazing.  Cheesy, salty goodness makes my belly so happy.  The dish came out piping hot and waiter man was great about bringing us some fresh chips when he saw our basket getting low.  I love attentive waiters! And I love Chili's!   So lets recap - Mango Iced Tea with free refills, Skillet Queso and Buffalo Chicken Salad with bacon and bleu cheese.  ::happy sigh::  Go to Chili's!  If there was one closer to my apt I'd probably be there right now...
I love the value of their lunch menu, with all the wonderful choices, there's something for everyone.

This was my first time ever coming to a Chili's and I'd have to say my experience wasn't too bad. My party of 5 was seating right away on a Wednesday afternoon as the place was not busy. What won me over is their happy hour specials. Their two for 1 well drinks or discounts on their beers was pretty nice. My friends and I got the frozen mango margarita, which was pretty good. I finished mine too quickly. It was worth it though and you can taste the tequila in it which was nice.  I had gotten the chipotle chicken bowl from their lunch special ($7) and it was good. Nothing stood out to me, but it wasn't like super special. Just your standard chipotle chicken bowl. My friend had gotten the 3 for $10 lunch special which came with a HUGE amount of chips and dip, a burger, and a mini chocolate cake for the dessert. All of it looked pretty good.  The service was good and our waitress kept bringing a lot of water to our table whenever she saw we were getting low. This is a place that I'd go back to catch up with some friends and just have a chill time with.

My family and I came here for my father's birthday and we had a wonderful experience. I got the $22 for 2 with my dad. For our appetizer we got those Texas Cheese fries and for our main entrees, I got half rack of baby back ribs with fries while my dad got grilled chicken fajita. I recommend both these meals! For dessert we all shared the Oreo molten chocolate cake which was delicious! Definitely recommend this place!

This was my first time eating at a Chili's restaurant and I know for sure that it won't be my last.  The service for one was one of the best services I've had at any restaurant.  The wait time for our food was very fast, based on previous experience I've had before, I was not expecting our food to get to our table so soon. The best part of my visit was our waitress, Jennifer! She was pleasant and very helpful when it came to helping us decide on what to order (I asked her what would she recommend ) everything on the menu looked so great! I got their ribs, and unlike other places, their ribs were amazing! It had that smoked flavor and didn't have a weird taste to it. Everything was cooked to perfection. I was quite nervous because it was my first time at chili's but I am sure glad I decided to give it a try. Another great thing is you won't have to worry about your pockets, their menu items are very very reasonable.
This place stinks , I will never come back the food sucks and the service is horrible I was very disappointed

The funny thing is I almost changed my mind and went someone else based on some of the reviews that I read but my family wanted to stay.  I don't normally give 5 stars but a combination of our great waiter, much better than expected food, and decent prices left me impressed.  Ryan was a great waiter, he was polite and had a great sense of humor. Ryan interacted well with my family and sold items on the menu to us by good explanation and again, subtle humor. Overall, excellent job.  We had the loaded boneless wings....:WOW! Much better than I anticipated, very cheesy and nice flavor!  I had a humongous burger, I was ashamed after eating it all! Lol.  They also had a pretty good $10 meal option of a nice sized salad, ample burger and a chocolaty dessert.  Overall, a good enough experience to come back to Chilis for sure!!

It is what it is. I can't help but feel I could taste some kind of soap in my twofer beers... I really like that the silverware come in their own package. One of my biggest pet peeves is utensils on a table. I thought it was was great that this issue was avoided. Dear ordered the three appetizer and it was good. I had the chicken crisper and can't complain. Service was slow but the place was packed. Not my typical dinner venue but it was good during the middle of the week. It's also kind on my wallet. I wouldn't go here on a weekend night, too much ruckus. If you're hungry I'd choose this over most any other mid range chain restaurant.

My husband and I used to frequent Chili's in Westbury years ago and had always liked the food. We decided to go again last night and it turned out to be my worst experience eating out. The service was okay excluding the rice left on the table from the previous dinner guests. The food however was horrible. My husband and I ordered the fajitas, I got shrimp and prime rib, he went with chicken and prime rib. The prime rib had the taste and texture of canned meat. The shrimp was stale, tough and tasteless.  Two hours after leaving the restaurant I was violently ill for the whole night. I'm sure that what I was experiencing was food poisoning from the shrimp. I will never go back.

I'm giving you 3 Stars Chili's which is sad because I've come here so many times over the years and yesterday was a complete disappointment. I was looking forward to their Queso appetizer as always but it was a total miss. It was so thick and just didn't taste good. I usual love the Queso and dig in but yesterday I had two bites and was done. I was hoping for better with my boneless buffalo chicken salad which was okay for a fast food joint. My only problem was it was loaded with salad dressing. Take the healthy right out of it why don't you. We also ordered the chicken enchiladas which were loaded with salt. Not a very enjoyable meal.  I also noticed a change in the menu I guess their trying to go the healthier route. I believe that anytime any restaurant makes a change to their menu it never works out sometimes change isn't good at least for fast food.  The customer service was fine and the usual just wish they wouldn't bring your meal out 5mins after your appetizer which whatever I'm so use it to already. Paying with there small portal TV makes it for a quick in and out meal since you don't have to wait for your waiter to come back with the check and then wait for your credit card back. 1,2,3 and done.

I was not wow'd at all here. Just a run of the mill boring experience. Maybe I need to go when its happy hour or when there is a rush. I felt like I was not even close to being a person who was important. Can't say I will return.
We had a nice meal. The food was good but the reason i gave five stars is that our server Eric was amazing. He went above and beyond, making our experience perfect. Thanks Eric

Poor service, good food. Went on a Saturday afternoon many open tables. We were seated right away and waited about 5 minutes for someone to take drink order and meal, soup and salad for me, chicken strips for hubby. It took about 15 minutes for delivery and they forgot salad. Took another 10 minutes for salad. Southwest soup was good but only warm, must have been sitting in the back before they brought it out.  Called manager and told her of the delay and that large group seated well after us had received their full order. For such a simple, small order on a slow time with many open tables no reason why server didn't check on us to see if we had everything, wanted refills, etc. SAD

We've eaten here countless times and is usually in our weekly rotation of "where to eat" lazy nights. The last couple of times we were here left us very disappointed  so we took a break for a few weeks.  Being all shopped out and hungry we decided to give it one more try. McDonalds would have been a better choice. We ordered the chicken ranch sandwich and chicken crispers. The waitress was nice enough and got our orders quickly which surprised me because the bar area is usually very slow.  The food came out quick, and hot...too hot, my chicken sandwich was like a hockey puck. It was so over cooked and it tasted like old oil. You know that taste that literally leaves that greasy coating on the roof of ur mouth...yes gross. Change the oil! The chicken crispers were not over coated but since it was fried in the same oil...yeah. Needless to say we won't be going back anytime soon.

Aside from the wait (which is expected on a Saturday night), this place is great! Our server, Aisha, was really nice and attentive to our party of 4 needs. We went with the 2 for $20 deal that was offered and got the fries pickles and onion rings as an appetizer with chicken fajitas as an entree. I ordered the mango margarita on the rocks which was nice! If you tell them you want less ice you'll get more product (if you know what I mean ). Overall, I would definitely recommend this Chilis.

Do not take out from here...EVER!!  Your order will not come out correct or things will be missing.  Happened once before, they were kind and sent me Chili's cash to refund me.   Gave them a second chance. Ordered 3 meals. Only 2 were given to me.   Now I am back to waiting for a refund in the mail since I paid cash and have no lunch.  Unacceptable

They've made improvements throughhout the years and have noticed. I come here about 2-3 times a year. And more often when I was in college.  Within the last few years, they've upgraded their technology. You can pay at the table, play games and even when waiting, you can get a text when your table is ready.  There are some food that are a little too salty. Like the chips with guacamole and the brocoli. I asked them not to put salt on my broccoli before, same with then chips...but i think the food is pre-packaged and all they do is put it in the microwave.  I've ordered different dishes and dont have any complaints about most dishes other than what I've mentioned.  Last night, I was there with family. We were all really pleased with our dinner. I had the combo meal. Salmon and steak made medium with loaded mash and brocoli. Cousin had the same as I, but without the salmon. My sister had the sweet and smoky burger: burger with melted pepper jack cheese, bacon, panko onion rings, lettuce, tomato, bbq sauce on the side, and onion rings. This burger is part of the new Craft Burger menu. It was really good. She kept saying, "this burger's bangin'!" Hahaha!   It was busy that night, and they seated us in 15 minutes. It was a great night. I would recommend.

Quiet Tuesday night at Chili's. Server was great. Had the 2 for $22 special. Had enough left over for Wednesday lunch and it was very good. Only issue was the restaurant was way too cold for our liking. Glad we brought jackets.

This used to be one of my favorite Chilli's to visit but I will never come here again. The appetizers were decent. I ordered the grilled shrimp, BBQ ribs with loaded potatoes and broccoli. My shrimp came out still grey, ribs and broccoli were cold. I only enjoyed my loaded potatoes. The manager came over and sent out another batch of ribs and broccoli but the ribs were only BBQ on one side. I was mortified. This place should be out of business. I wouldn't recommend this spot to anyone.
I like the dessert and the enchiladas. I had a molten lava cake. I had chilis at least twice in my life. Its a quick dine in and out.

Food was overdone, waited for a long time when the place was pretty empty.  Usually I like the place, however this time so disappointed.  Manager did a bad job of rushing replacement food out rather than just refunding meal.

The worst service it took the server 25 minutes to take my order I had to walk out and leave she took 2 peoples orders before mine and they got here after me. I wasn't sure what I wanted so she cut me off half way and went to go attend someone else. I won't be coming here. When I did get to order it was rushed

Pretty decent place, went there for dinner and was seated within 15 minutes of getting there. Place is quiet busy so expect to wait a little. Food as good and so was the drinks. Took a while to come out, over all pretty decent place to grab something to eat. Chips are a bit salty.

Check the nutrition listings before you go to eat at Chili's. Chili's needs to include that icon with the salt shaker in the triangle on their menu. I went to Chili's for lunch today to try their Fire Peppers Chicken Crispers. Now I wish that I had not. Later in the day, I saw an article stating the sodium content of that meal. It was way over the top. In some area's restaurants are required by law to put a the icon of a salt shaker in a triangle, if something contains more than a day's worth of sodium. If Chili's had done that, then I would have ordered something else. Now I doubt that I will ever dine at Chili's ever again.

I'm writing yet another review of this restaurant in hopes that someone in management will actually read it and heed the call. For some reason members of my family love to go to this place but as I've written before there is a serious problem with the temperature of their food. No matter what I get I can be assured it will be cold. It's not even that the food is that bad, it's just always cold or luke warm. I've actually seen Yelp reviews that have been answered by management so I'm hoping someone who works there will read this!

Myself and 4 friends visited the Westbury Chili's on Monday, January 2 at 8pm in the evening. As soon as we walked in, there were some people waiting but there was no hostess. For about 4-5 minutes, we waited at the hostess area with noone around. A couple minutes later, shefinally came by and rudely said "excuse me" because I was leaning on the hostess area because I have torn ligaments in my foot. So I moved and I expected her to apologize for the long and unacceptable wait just to put our name in. Nope! Once we were seated, we all discussed that we wanted the guacomole so when our waiter arrived, we said asked for it and he told us that he was very busy and if we could give him a break and not order it. Never in all of my dining out have I ever heard that. I wanted to still order it but my buddies feared what might happen to our entres once we ordered them. Our waiter had the nerve to say that he could come back with the avocados and the raw materials and that WE could mix it ourselves. UNACCEPTABLE. Getting crackers for my chili and 5 waters was even met with attitude. This boggles my mind because he had time to interrupt our conversation about Universal Studios to ramble on and talk abt his vacation to Disney world to us while we payed the check. Maybe some better time management is in order, sir!

Horrible service!!  My first time at this franchise and probably my last. Our waitress was not attentive to our party of 13. I guess because gratuity was guaranteed she could careless and not once asked the table if anyone wanted refills or napkins.  Two of our party members were here to celebrate their birthdays and when we asked to have them sung happy birthday our waitress just gave us a look and walked away. The only way we got service was if we had to hunter her down. She never asked if the Food was ok, never asked what she can do to make our service better and at the end didn't even ask if we wanted dessert. She never said goodnight after she dropped the food off she was gone for the rest of the night. Not one plate was removed from the table when the entrees arrived so we had to move the plates our selves and put them on the side. I didn't come here to work I came to enjoy time with my family and unfortunately I did not. Never again...

Where do I start.. Lets see.. Waitress came to take our order for drinks.. I inquired if a particular beer was on draft.. It wasnt.. I ordered it anyway..  You think the waitress would have advised me of the 2 for 1 draft beer specials.. Nope.. Next the salsa dip tasted like pickle juice.. The tortilla chips had waaaay too much salt on them... The waitress asked if we wanted our fajitas spicey.. We said yes.. Unfortunately there was no spiciness to them.  My carnita fajita and everything with it tasted like burnt skillet.. . I guess this is why we haven't been here in years.. Still disappointed...

I came after work , I wanted something quick we drove by and I have never been here before so of course I wanted to try it .  For Tuesday nite which is a slow nite around 9pm it was pretty empty it was plenty of seats if we wanted a table but I always sit at the bar .  The bartender was great very attentive and friendly , I ordered the peach margarita & I was very happy my drink was so big lol .  I really liked all the meal specials they had and it took me a while because I wanted everything, I end up going with the 2 for $20 which is the appetizer & 2 entrees .  The food came out fast and the chicken bacon ranch quesadilla was yummy I def enjoyed it the second entree I wrapped up to eat the next day at work . But all in all I had a great exp I will def be back soon !

I had by far the BEST service from the waiter Ben. We came in with a group of 15-20 special needs young adults and the service was AMAZING. He was great with the participants and never skipped a beat. Always served with a smile on his face and a pep in his step. Deffenitly coming back!!!!!!!!! Thank you Ben for a great experience!

0 star review! One of the worst chain restaurants I have ever been to :( Came here for the unlimited enchiladas and had food poisoning the next day. Even though the restaurant was nearly empty at 4 pm, we were somehow put by the back corner. Our table was dirty and had left over food (including a juicebox and dirty napkins) The service was extremely slow and our waitress barely made eye contact and acted like she did not want to be there. She kept on walking pas us and not check up on us. Our water cups were empty most of the time. When it comes to the enchiladas, i have nothing good to say... The first round had maybe 1/2 meat and a little big of sauce, looked similar to the menu image and tasted 6/10  The 2nd round consists of two wraps with one tsb of meat each. By the 3rd round, we were eating just the wraps and 1 pinch of meat... and it was barely warm... I will never return to this restaurant due to the bad service and inability to bring food that actually taste like food
Good food, worth waiting for.  Andi was our waitress and was very nice.  Brian, the store manager checked in with us and made sure we were happy.  We'll be back again.

Pretty decent food. Had better service the last time I came. I guess it depends on who is working and who is in charge.  Be careful with the the table games they add an extra $1 to your bill for table entertainment.
Service was good food was delivered promptly. Still chain food but the staff was courteous and came by to ensure you were served. So basically three stars because of the staff.

I used to love this particular chillis of westbury . It used to be up to point . Now a days its gone down, in quality and quantity. I ordered triple dipper with eggrolls, onion rings, bafflo chicken. Egg rolls are vry small ,greasy. And they gv us oly one sause to dip .comeooooon ....................triple dip means three sauses. Wn we asked abt it they brt us oly one sause again. And my raspberry lemonade has ant in it . Wn we showed them offcorse they replaced it otherone . But didn't feel like drinking it . Totally never again to this spot .

Me and my family came to this place plenty of times and the result is always great. The food is a cheap price especially if you do the $20 for 2 dinner deal. The only bad side is it's always busy and the wait is about 40 minutes.

Was there today at 1:00 the place was empty and I could see why. Drinks came after the apps and only because I asked where they were ( mind you it was just 2 sodas). The server sucked, never came to check after the meal was brought until we were done , asked if I wanted to wrap my food which was gross and tasted like bologna . Which if you had come by and checked server you would of know that. my daughters sides showed up after she finished her meal. First time here and last
My Boyfriend Alex, his Mom Ronnie & I Loved the Food, the Drinks & the Desserts & would Love to come back to Chili's, our Waitress Rachael was so nice to us, We Love Chili's

I enjoy the cuisine and the great 2 for $35 bundle. I was shocked to be good for the first time (multiple visits) that I could not use my rewards with the bundle. The waitress Monique presented a restriction as I normally order more items with my rewards. The norm is tableside guacamole. I was shutdownbefore I could give more business,very disappointing.
One of my favorite casual chill spots. The Chilli's at Roosevelt Raceway Center in Westbury is clean and the staff is on point!! It's a little chilly in here (pun intended) so bring a sweater.

I love that they revamped their menu infusing it with more dishes and even offer table side guacamole but come on, how do you rid the menu of the best ribs--Dry Memphis Rub!?? Chili's, stop playing and bring back the Memphis Dry Rub.  I also noticed that some locations stopped offering the "happy-hour 2:1" deal. What's up with THAT!?? What's next, the awesome cheese cake with strawberry sauce??

Not that I expect great food at Chili's, but a few years ago it was a decent meal.  We went a few weeks ago and it was horrible.   The "salsa" they serve tastes like ketchup.  The fajitas were soggy.  The service was slow.   Never going back.

I guess I have to give Chilis one star (by default.) This being my first review I hesitantly descend down the path of food and business snobbery, and  I don't know if its even fair to begin bottom feeding on the likes of a discount chain such as Chili's, but this experience has created a need to verbify a website, and for the first time YELP.          Crowded to start, in retrospect can't even understand what the wait might be for, seeing that there is a halfway decent Cantina type spot two doors down. They tell us of a 25-35 minute wait and ask for a phone number.      Moments later we receive a text confirming we are on the list and it includes a link to download the app . It says "Check you place in line with our APP!" Considering we are two, and low wage hostesses are not usually the best logistical calculators, we stay after seeing 9 open tables and 2 finishing.  We also Also download the APP so we can SEE OUR PLACE IN LINE!.       Now Chilis, as a corporation does my first experience using your new "technology" have to be a complete sham for you to obtain contact information?  "There are 5+ parties ahead of you" DUH... that's why we downloaded the app to see how many there were, or is solely intended to be for people who are unable to count to 5? Worthless!           After 25 minutes we were seated, several of the previously mention available tables were still not being patronized, and for a little bit of fun we checked the app again, you know to measure your technological advances, and still there were 3 parties ahead of us at time of seating, .       Now the above was just the opening act, we came because we were hungry, had the reached the end of a strip of restaurants, and thought hey why not go here.    The first thing we got was the fried asparagus, besides the breading almost completely falling off, after a little self assembly they tasted fine. We never had it before and thought hey this is good. Then came our dishes, not only Yelp worthy, but worthy of opening a Yelp account to do so!   1. Shrimp is not white, or spongy, or under cooked, or chewier than the gum that had just been spit out. It was pink in the picture so it should have been on her plate. My GF had about three bites and was already thinking her stomach was going to hurt.   She does not eat meats besides fish and shellfish, so the thoughtful gesture of INCLUDING A CHICKEN CUBE IN HER RICE was not so well received.  2. I did not order my fajita meat, med, rare, and spoiled.  Unless that is the combo where you get different styles all on the same plate.  The beef tasted rancid, but the carnitas tasted worse. They were even more unpalatable, and gritty, and also had several different temperatures of cooking. About 3 bites total before we were on to the check.    They forgot to bring us the rice that was an upsize option for .99 with the fajitas, so the manager had to be found to take that off the check.     I understand that you are a chain,  you offer lower priced food.  But you market yourself as fresh, and it just wasn't even within an acceptable time-frame of being fresh.  I took the items to go,just  to get a second opinion, and gave the instructions "just taste that" and they spit it out.   The only reason i did not bring it to the attention of management because, I did not want to be punished with the potential that another option may be offered. That was the last time Chilis will be an option, and even if it was the only option I would decline. A more fitting slogan should be "I want my moneyback, moneyback moneyback." Because you did not serve food that was edible, and the only reason i just paid it,  was because i did not want to bring any stress to a Chili's waitress who probably had to deal with the repercussions of your poor management, and terrible products.

I have been to this Chili's a couple times and last night was definitely the LAST TIME!  Went in at 8pm.  Was seated within 5 minutes.  Wasn't until 8:35 that our waitress AnnMarie (god bless her), who was beyond overworked in an unbelievably understaffed restaurant, even had a chance to come and take our drink order.  She came took our drink over and food order.  Our fresh guacamole with SUPER SUPER SUPER salty tortilla chips came at 9:10pm.  At almost 9:40 our entrees came.  All 3 entrees had a problems 1.  cheese enchiladas:  only 2 of the 3 enchiladas were on the plate, rice was super undercooked 2. ribs with black beans - black beans were definitely not black beans 3. explosion salad with chicken - was given the wrong salad and was missing the chicken Finally at this point I complained to the manager about the experience.  I made it clear that it was due to the lack of staffing.  It was obvious that the restaurant was understaffed since they had the host(ess) bussing tables.  The manager was less than helpful but did insult our waitress Annmarie by saying that she "sometimes did a good job".  Annmarie was trying her best with the little staff there was in the restaurant. Food sucked, experience sucked.  Would not return and with a manager that truly didn't care, I would suggest others do not give patronage there either.
I've never been to a chili's before but I went yesterday in Westbury, this is my new restaurant I luv it, plus luv the Margaritas

Went with my family a party of 8. We all ordered our food at one time. 2 out of 8 meals were incorrect. After 3 times of going back and forth they finally brought us the correct meal. This process took about 1 hour. Ask to speak to a manager and that took over 30 min waiting on her. This place is absolutely horrible and the bathroom has pee on the floor and garbage over flowing with paper towels. I will say our waiter Zae was great and felt our pain. But yet again, this resturant needs help. Don't recommend coming here..

The manager was not welcoming at all. He sat two patrons down before us and showed them how to use the digital menu at the table.  He didn't say hi to us. He just said let me wipe your table down and walked away. I'll never come back to this Chili's establishment EVER again! Based off of that small interaction this place gets 1 star. It shouldn't even be getting that.
The new salmon with green sauce is delicious.  Had it with corn on the cob and broccoli, fabulous.  JD the server was attentive and pleasant.

Went there with the family to celebrate my 13 yr old sons Birthday...hey that's where he wanted to go! Saturday night right smack during the 7:30 rush!  Called at 7 to reserve a table for 5.  Was told they don't take reservations...I said...look it's my sons Birthday, can you just hold a table or we won't bother coming!  She said...ok yes sir no problem.  Got there right at 7:30, parked in a full lot, walked into the doors and BOOM!  Jam packed with about 50 people trying to get a table!  Walked up to their "Hostess"? Server?  I dunno but she had an ipad with a seating chart..pow!  Right this way sir and we walked passed everyone and seated immediately.  Maybe she thought I was an undercover Boss! Was taken for $1 from that table top tablet thingy because my daughter wanted to press all the games on the screen.  Don't really know why that thing is there, no one uses it except to give away $1! Had entree for two x2.5. More than enough to eat!  Apps came out fast, dinner served quick!  Waitress was friendly, bubbly, at ease, professional, did not seem phased at all by the pressure of two hundred people in her area! Getting to the restroom was another story, had to push our way through 50 pissed off people waiting for a table since they were on the other side of the restaurant and you needed to walk passed the entrance to get there!  I saw a family that was there before we walked in still waiting for a table. Had dessert, bill for 5...$88, left 22% tip! she deserved every penny!  Honestly I don't know how anyone makes any money there with the work they do and the cheap prices for a surmountable amount of food and beverage. Walked passed the family that came in before us, they were just getting their drinks! WTF? Make a reservation!!! We were in and out in 1 1/2 hrs. Drove home stuffed. Had food coma, passed out on the couch!

The 2 for $20 is a great deal, it fills you up and it's a good amount of food for the money you are paying. They use electronic kiosks to check out or pay for your bill so that makes leaving go by fast. The staff seem nice but overwhelmed at times and rush things.
This place is great to have a nice meal for a decent price.  I have a family of four and we love dining at Chili's.   Love this place, we are here at least once or twice a month.

Good food and great deals! Whats the catch? The looong wait. If you have a big party, make sure to call ahead and add your name to the list, especially weekend evenings. This location allows you to do so, though Im not sure about the other Chili's.  The 2 for $20 deal gives you a choice of an appetizer and two entrees all for 20 bucks. We ordered the guacamole to start and as a main course we had the chicken fajitas and the Cajun chicken pasta - both equally good! The fajitas come sizzling with all the fixings including cheese, sour cream, guac, tortillas, jalapeños and salsa. The portions were just right and our service was great. Our server regularly refilled our drinks and was very friendly. We never felt rushed even as the crowd waiting to be seated kept growing. The pièce de résistance was our molten lava cake with vanilla ice cream. Delicious and rich. Warm and cold. Always the way to go.

The problem is with Chili's To Go: they have a dedicated To Go counter, but they never use it.  This counter is conveniently located right next to a "mini To Go parking lot," but instead of parking and picking up an order, the customer is always told to inquire at the bar about their pickup order (apparently in an attempt to get To Go customers to buy a drink).  Many times the bar is crowded, you can't get the attention of anyone behind the bar, and you have to actually wait behind people drinking at the bar in order to get your order.  The "To Go" feature at Westbury-Chili's is a bust: it's simply too much of a hassle and takes too much time for a service that was supposed to provide a quick, easy pickup.  Never again.

Huge, huge, HUGE lines on the weekend, but during the week there's no wait. I've never been to a different Chili's, but the food was on par with Apple Bee's. Not out of this world, but decent. 2 for $20 deal is awesome, and the waiter gave us a few awesome alternatives we ended up taking him up on, like upgrading some the appetizer and entree for $1 more. Overall.. decent spot. Just think Apple Bee's/TGI Friday's in terms of quality.

Food is good here in this particular location. This Chili's hires many college kids and it shows in their inexperience. The wait staff are cordial, but they lack the skill sets in customer service 101.   We came in as a table for two and they only gave us silverware for one.  When we ordered our meals and they came, they never asked if we needed a refill, our glasses were empty "0" in the tank. The waiter walked passed up several times and never even looked at our table again after the initial order was placed.  I had to flag him down for the check  Like I said, the food quality is good though, unfortunately the poor training in the service staff shows and dragged the rating down, at least for me.

I've been a loyal customer forever at this location. The bartenders are skilled and the chefs are amazing! Order the Southwest Egg Rolls as an appetizer. The Fajitas and spicy shrimp tacos are delicious also. The service is impeccable and they seat very quickly.

As the closest Chili's to us, we've been dining here as a family for many years now, and as a couple for many years before that, and very rarely have we received decent service from the wait staff. I can understand that they have a high staff turnover rate as most cheap chains do, but shouldn't friendliness, attentiveness, and basic levels of competency be a prerequisite for hiring? At this Chili's, it seems not. Also, it seems that cleanliness here has really gone downhill. Everything is sticky and they use the same, old, dirty rag to wipe everything, yet clean nothing. :(
My Family and I went there for a late dinner. Food was great, service was excellent . Our waiter was very attentive and quick with everything. He was very nice. I would definitely go again!!!!
There is a new menu with healthy food options. Service is friendly food is served quickly.  The resturant is clean

My family and I ate here today because my sister kept talking about how good there food was, and I must admit she was right.  As a party of 6 we were sitted very quickly. We were given two servers and they both were very friendly and polite.  My sister raved about the Southwestern Egg Roll as an appetizer. Omg they were so good. I had the Fajita Trio good lord I didn't know I would receive so much food.  Overall the meal was great, the service was fast and the Mango tea was the best. I will definitely recommend eating here and I will surely eat there again.

I had the rib lunch special. We had the half order of BBQ ribs with the Dr. Pepper sauce and it was delicious. It came with fries which were good, It also came with a small salad that was good. It has came with a Molten Chocolate Cake which was amazing.  We also had their Fried Asparagus which was very tasteful. I also had the Loaded Baked Potato Soup which was very good. The waiter was nice and friendly.

Went tonight with some friends i haven't seen in a bit. We had a very nice server who was on her first day here and i could tell she was nervous and we told her we were an easy table and to have fun. We had sparkling pomegranate margaritas and they were yummy. We split the skillet queso and the pretzel appetizers. The only problem was they gave us like the bottom of the bag of chips so it was like crumbs and hard to really use them for a dip,,,and the cheese that comes with the pretzels was not hot and pretty solid not creamy. But i had the margarehita flatbread pizza and mashed pot and we split a santa fe salad. Holy shit its spicy but good. Had a lot of leftovers to bring home to my bf who enjoyed them as well.

Been to this place over 100 times. Searing gets slow at night on Fri and sat but they have the best chips and salsa around and they are free and bottomless if you drink at the bar not sure if they still do that as I haven't been in two tears.  They. Have two for one drinks bit their glasses are very devieving, they look big but its all glass as it only holds barely one little beer can each. I'd go back for their chips and salsa and have just get them that to go dozens of times, very fresh
Luv Chilis! Great food, drinks and it will never put a hole in your wallet! Can't beat it! Always Clean and friendly service.

The food was good, but not great. We had a corner seat right by the kitchen so it was a little noisy. My wife ordered the sirloin steak and it was cooked medium well, but not very juicy. Last time they put some butter on top, but not this time. I think that makes a big difference. However, our cookie-in-a-skillet dessert was amazing! The service was very good though and they took good care of us. I would come here again, I think we may have just caught them one night that the kitchen wasn't at their best.

The waitress was very attentive and the food and drinks were  not only what I expect from a restaurant but what I'll accept. Only problem, because of the electric kiosks, there is very little host/hostess costumer interactions.

I'm a fan. I don't care if it's a chain restaurant. The food here is good and I prefer this place over Applebee's, TGI Friday's, Red Lobster, and even the nearby Cozy Mel's. My husband and I had a good experience. We had great service, even had a conversation with one of the waiters. We started with a triple dipper combo consisting of southwestern egg rolls, big mouth bites, and boneless buffalo wings. We then proceeded to the bacon ranch chicken quesadillas. Everything we had was delicious and plentiful. We also had the mango iced tea, it was yummy. The best part about this place is that the movie theater is nearby and lots of parking. Overall, I'm happy.

Expect a wait. At least 45 minutes on a typical weekend night. Why? Because it's that good. Chili's offers some basic  building blocks for a little happiness in life. Good solid food. Reasonable prices. Friendly and accommodating staff.  A clean festive venue to socialize in. A place to get away from it all if only for a little bit. This Chile's is pretty big, bright, and lively with many colorful multi-tiled topped tables, booths, and a sizable bar. There is always a big mass of hungry people, families and young adults, waiting to get seated on a Friday and weekend nights. You can call ahead for call ahead seating, although I have not tried that. The servers were very nice and the guys were very built and pleasant to look at.  My single friend could hardly contain herself. If you join the Chili's Email Club you can get emails  with exclusive offers. I recently got an email for a free appetizer with a purchase of an entree. When you first join the email club you get a voucher for free queso and chips. The club sends a lot of different coupons over a course of time. Here's the good stuff: - Southwestern Egg Rolls $8.29 6 crispy flour tortilla filled with smoked chicken, black beans, corn, jalapeño Jack cheese, red peppers and spinach. Served with avocado-ranch dressing that had more ranch than avocado. This is absolutely delicious, rich, and flavorful. -Fire Grilled Corn Guacamole $5.29 Made with fresh avocados, cilantro, house-made pico de gallo, fire-grilled corn and jalapeños. Served with tostada chips and house-made salsa. Sweet, cool, and creamy. -Margarita Grilled Chicken $10.79 Classic Margarita-flavored grilled chicken with hints of lime and citrus, served with rice, black beans, tortilla strips and house-made pico de gallo. One of the healthier meals with only 550 calories and with good flavors. Heartening, nourishing, and tasty. -Fajita Trio Fajitas$14.89 Meaty grilled steak, tender chicken and scrumptious spicy garlic and lime shrimp with grilled onions and peppers. Served with 3 warm tortillas, house-made pico de gallo, mixed cheese and sour cream.  I would order it Cadillac style with rice and black beans for $0.99. The 3 tortillas it came with are small and may not be enough to use all the meat on the skillet. -2 for 1 beers on Friday night. We got 2 mugs of bud light for $4. Come to Chili's!

I cannot fathom why there are not more of this chain on Long Island. They have like 90 TGI Fridays but Chili's are few and far between. I really like to come to this location when I'm in the area and so do a lot of other people because this location is ALWAYS crowded. Good luck finding a spot in the lot and have fun waiting 45 minutes or more to be seated. Wait... I can't.. do this! Too many bad words that will tarnish the one Chili's. It's too good! I love you Chili's! Your food, your prices... it's just too much for me to handle! I'll put up with the parking and the waiting just to sample some of your cheap and delicious foods.  I love spicy food and almost everything on the menu is spicy or can be spicy at your request. Cozy Mel's (in the same restaurant pavilion) wishes they could execute a restaurant this good. I love their appetizers and their 2 entrees and one appetizer for 20$ menu. Maybe there should only be one that way it doesn't become so widespread, overdone and hackneyed like the TGI Friday's (the epidemic that's hit Long Island). No... there can be only one. My precious!
A Few of Us went There after our Movie Matinee.We are all satisfied,the Service was Good,The wait was not long at all,and Our waiter was Super.Way to Go Chili s

I came here last Saturday and I prefer this location over the one in atlas park mall in queens.  There's less waiting time, better quality of food and service. The menu always seems to be changing but that's good as the same things can become boring after a while I had boneless wings with a combo plate of chicken with ribs. The food was good but I think I prefer their sauced ribs over dry rub ones I picked.  They have a small kiosk on top of each table with games, you can also order dessert drinks and pay your bill

I've literally seen this chili's location diminish in quality over the years and what is left is a dead, nasty shell of what a decent chain restaurant used to be. This is my last time coming here. Granted, this is a chain so you can't expect the best dining experience, you get what you pay for, but really how do you screw up fried food and a few beers. This location is not upholding their company standards.

A nightmare from the beginning!  I placed my order online. I was trying to avoid getting out of the car with a 1.5yr old. I go ahead and place my order. I pull up and, NO curb side pick up! Annoyed already! Get inside- no one to greet you but a sign saying to pick up orders at the bar- fine. First, the bar is PACKED!! I wait at least 5 minutes before the one bartender even looks my way! I make my way over to him, theres not a spot opened-so now I have to talk over the people who are eating at the bar. SO NOT COOL!  Who wants to be screamed over while you eat!?? I sure don't! Anyway, he takes my name and goes in the back to get my order- He disappears for 10 mins! Really!!?? I show up ON TIME to pick up my order (curb side) which they DIDN'T have. Now, my foods not ready? My nerves are starting to kick in. Finally, I get my order, check it and yes- I am missing an item! Now, I have to go back to the very busy bar to say that I am missing food.  I have a screaming, unhappy toddler in my arm at this point! What a HORRIBLE experience. I will NEVER go to this Chilies again.  Oh-and nowhere do I see it say that this location does not have curb side pick up (unless i missed it).

This place is ok when you decide to eat in. However, when you call in an order I can only say one thing Hot Mess!!! You stand there for about twenty minutes even though you order 40 minutes ago , so get with the program.

Did the two for $20 here for dinner. We got chips and salsa to start. The chips were light and crispy and positively addicting. The salsa was good too. We each got the chicken fajitas, where were nowhere as good as they smelled. The chicken wasn't well done enough. In retrospect I probably should've sent it back. The onions and peppers were sad and limp and curiously devoid of any real flavor. The little dishes of condiments accompanying the fajitas were cute and contained some good choices, including a spicy butter and a jalapeño onion relish, which at least lent some spice and flavor to the otherwise bland food. Our waiter was Tyler; he was very friendly and did a great job, checking on us frequently. Have had much better experiences at Chilis. This was pretty disappointing, albeit cheap.

Chili's has 'jumped the shark". Service today at lunch was awful. We waited 25 minutes for our food. Waitress did nothing to move the kitchen along and did not refill drinks. manager finally had to come along after our complaints and he comped us the meal that my husband never got to eat. Food was too salty. I will go elsewhere next time.

Really great food and service. The spinach artichoke dip is great. Wings are average and they over-do it a little on the sauce. Ordered the honey BBQ chicken tenders and sweet potato fries. I played Trivia while I was eating. Did I mention they have tablets with unlimited games for 99 cents extra? Great deal, isn't it? You can even pay the bill and tip the waitress on them! Great place, but tell them to put sauce on the side. :)

While the food is by no means fantastic, it is a much better chain for low-key dinners as compared to, say, Applebee's. There are great specials that are a company thing, but almost all of our servers have been really kind. I've never received service from anyone at the restaurant that made me go "wow", but this place will do its job to satisfy your hunger. Sometimes my order will mess up (cook's fault, I suppose) or an item wasn't put in (and I therefore have to wait another 10-15 minutes for it), but I'm willing to put up with it as long as my family members like coming here.  Wait times can be 20-60+minutes during weekends - I usually wait 30-45. You can call ahead to put your name on the list so that the wait can be shorter for you. My deepest wish for this place is that the menu lists food allergies or contamination from shared oil or pots CLEARLY next to each food item. This is a practice that's becoming more common. While Chili's website has a list of food allergies, it is inconvenient to have to look it up each time and just takes more time to place the order. The waiters should be more trained in knowledge of what food allergies and specialty diets mean, and how to properly ask the right questions so that nobody has a breakout or a really upset stomach when arriving home (me).

This restaurant doesn't even deserve one star. I ordered the mango chipotle chicken and it came out with brown, spoiled broccoli. My boyfriend got the fajitas and ordered seared shrimp on the side and the shrimp was raw. Also, the waitress brought me out my entree 20 mins before my boyfriends. Horrible service and food--don't go here if you don't want to get sick!

I love going to Chili's but I definitely will not come back to this one.  People said you can tell if the restaurant is clean or not by the cleanliness of the bathroom.  My husband went to the bathroom and he said urine were all over the floor.  He didn't even want to touch the door.  He then passed by the kitchen, the garbage were piled high and overflow.  As for the food, I ordered the Caribbean Salad which I love to eat.  The lettuce was really bitter.  Just horrible!  My husband ordered the spareribs.  There were practically no meat on the ribs.  That, we had to tell the waitress to bring it back to the kitchen and get us another plate.  Never coming back!

Worst service ever!!! Server was terrible. Tried to seat us at a dirty table multiple times and had the nerve to say "what to you expect its late at night" I expect good customer service. Of course I needed to speak to a manager immediately. Everyone  cannot work in public service!  No 2fers for me today!!

You be the judge... We ordered chips with salsa and paid for the extra guacamole. Chips were extremely greasy.  Salsa was very watery and barely stayed on the chip.   Guacamole was decent. The chicken fajita was weird.  The chicken quality is not the best, and it seemed to be very skimpy with the peppers, onions, and rice.  Just seems like a poor value, and I only ate half of it because it just didn't taste that fresh... One mango iced tea was decent and not overly watered down, the other blackberry iced tea tasted funny (almost like a beer taste) and had to be replaced with another.  Aparently, it still had a mild beer taste to it.  Either it tastes like beer, or the plastic mugs they are using may be poorly washed and you may be drinking someone else's beer schwag that sat at the bottom (let's hope this isn't true). One of us ordered a grilled chicken dish and the chicken had a weird skin piece on it that even the waitress thought was strange.  They took the piece of chicken back and left the rest of the plate.  Well over 10 minutes later, the waitress came back with another piece of chicken on a small dish.  Most of us were just bout done eating by the time we got the replacement chicken piece.  They didn't even offer to take that meal off the bill. The fries were decent.   Overall, service was functional, but I would not rave at all about it. Gotta give this location a Thumbs Down...I have had better meals at different Chili's locations. Definitely needs improvement.

An insane wait but a good experience. Good selection of appetizers.   Guacamole burger really good.  Good atmosphere for kids.  Loud.  Good service.  Good desserts. I am not a chain food guy but good for groups.  Fair prices.

Ok so I don't know where to begin. Sat down at 230pm to eat at the bar. One girl to run the bar, serve, and make drinks for tables. She was totally swamped and not her fault. So I waited 50 minutes for a fajita and a 10ounce steak. The steak came with corn on the cob totally cold and the steak looked like it crawled onto the plate from a swamp in New Jersey which was also cold. Fajitas never came so I said screw it, take it all of the bill. Talked to Scott the manager who did not understand how to run a bar. Guy was useless. The kitchen manager came to offer me new food, I declined. Swamp Thing eats better than this!!!!!!!

I love Chili's but they have recently started pouring my beloved El Presidente from a tap. If the management of Chili's "my favourite chain" reads these reviews .Please let the bartenders do their job. Don't let the corporate scum win. Only a human can make a perfect Margarita.

I grew up eating at Chili's but my experience with this Chili's is only average. The menus they gave us were wet and uncleaned. Bathroom was all wet and slippery. Other than its sanitary issues, foods are barely above average.

Well Chili's, Applebees, and Friday's are all on the same line of Chains. Not much I  expected and not much did I receive. Came here on a late Monday night, decent amount of people, "ok" waitstaff, seemed like they were always in a rush, probably looking forward to closing. The food? forgettable, I got a trio fajita dish, that just sizzled dry before I could devour it. Very bland. Margarita drink was ok, did enjoy it as the juice that it was since you can barely taste the liquor in it.  HOWEVER dessert??? the chocolate chip cookie with ice cream REALLY saved this whole experience. Def outstanding. If it's raining and no place else around is open and I'm not too hungry I will settle and come back.

The food is always great, sizes of portions vary each time I come here though.Last time I was here I had an amazing waiter and even made up a vegetarian option for me. This time we we a rude waitress who didn't seem to care much about her job. But overall this is a good place to eat

Chili's is definitely evolving with the times.  This is our "go-to" spot for low key dinners with our toddler.  We get four beers (two adults), appetizer (we love the mozzi sticks), entrees and a kids meal.  With tip we still come out under $50 and it's a great, relaxing experience.   We live nearby and only go mid-week, the wait for this spot can get crazy.

Came here for drinks during Sunday happy hour while we waited for out table at Joe's Crab Shack. Sat at the bar and the entire thing was sticky. As if they drop liquor on the counter all day and don't clean it up. So the happy hour special is 2 for 1 drinks. They bring you both drinks at the same time. The drinks are only subpar as are missing the alcohol. Sooo I guess that's where all the alcohol on the bar came from

Ben and eric was our waiter and went smoothly until our friend coudnt find his phone so we had to end our night a bit early....But they new toys and they if u want to play games while eating...or you can just pay your bill right there without having to call your waiter so will be back to enjoy just this time was short.

I don't know whats happening to Chili's. I used to love it. All of the menu items seem to taste the same these days.  On my last visit, I ordered the buffalo chicken salad - how can you miss, right? It;s greens, bacon, pico, cheese and a chicken cutlet with hot sause on it. The salad was so soggy and over dressed that  i chose to pick thru and only eat the chicken, which was a pre-fab frozen chicken breast - thats ok, but when I told the server of my choice to eat thru the bad salad, she didnt seem to care. I wasnt asking for it to taken off the bill, but she could have offered fresh lettuce or something. Another guest at our table got the set of 4 sliders - they were burnt. the french fries were the only good thing in the.  And this is interesting - the next booth over got fajitas - and they come sizzling on that little pan, they weren't cooked in - its for effect -and whatever they drizzle on the heated pan to make the sizzle noise and smoke was so overpowering - my eyes were watering and the acrid smell was just awful. C.mon Chilis - you used to be so delicious !!

I hadn't been to Chili's in about 15 years (when I was much younger and didn't know any better).  Back when I had no real concern about  what went into my body during finals week in grad school (the rule is that you can eat whatever you want in order to say alive during finals week), my go to was the Chicken Crispers.  I haven't eaten them since as they have enough fat and calories to kill a small island of people, but because we were hungry with a child in tow(and I have fond memories), we decided to revisit (it was a revisitation for me, my husband had never previously had the pleasure of surrendering his will to live to Chili's).  The first thing we noticed upon being seated in a booth, was the filthy sticky table and dirty menus.  This should have been the sign we needed to just get up and go somewhere else, but we stuck it out.  My husband ordered a beer (for which he waited literally 20 minutes,) and a full rack of ribs which were unsatisfying at best. Despite WANTING the chicken Crispers with every fiber of my being, I ordered a steak burrito (which I'm sure is not a healthy option, but compared to the chicken Crispers, it's a spa salad).  The burrito was pretty tasteless, which is surprising.  How does one fuck up a burrito?  It basically tasted like nothing and was a fairly boring eating experience until I felt a sharp pain and my mouth started bleeding.  I spit out the offending bite, and found a medially sized jagged shard of wood IN my burrito.  I mentioned it to the waitress and she apologized and removed my food.  The manager (who was appropriately contrite) came over and apologized but said "I can't imagine what that could be bother than a chicken bone."  When I informed her that I had ordered the steak burrito, she said it must be a piece of a wooden skewer.  She apologized and comped my disgusting burrito (although imo, she should have comped all of our food as that was substantially  large infraction.  Because we were still hungry, we did order an additional appetizer size of the chicken Crispers, but either they had changed since the last time I ordered them, or I just had horribly shitty taste as a 25 year old, because they were beyond gross and my husband and I were both doubled over in stomach pain for the entire night.  Chili's will not be a place that we go EVER again, but when we left there was a rather long line, so I am surprised that SO many people are willing to consume such shitty food on such a regular basis.  America, you confuse me.

After taking a few dips into the delicious guacamole we found a roach! Yes people a ROACH!!! ALL JOKES ASIDE IT WAS A HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE!!! Upon notifying the manager ( Frank Gomes ) he apologized & said we just recently exterminated, that there was no excuse for it but he didn't comp the meal... mind you at the time we have yet to receive our entrees! NEVER AGAIN!!! NEEDLESS TO SAY IT WAS MY FIRST TIME AT CHILI'S!!!

I was here about a year earlier and found it surprisingly good back then - easy 4 stars for food taste, freshness, service, etc.  My, how a year changes things!   This time around, the ribs were stale, the wings all breading and no meat. The service was callous bordering on rude, and barely present. Big drinks though - that counts for something... I guess.
Pretty good time enjoyed myself..simply laid back restaurant with good vibes..the food was good the portions were great and the food was good

Flithy !!! Crumbled up napkins, straw wrappers, food, and discarded kid menus ALL over the floors.  Its very obvious that no one here knows how to use a broom and/or the employees have back problems that prevent them from bending over to pick up the debris. The funny thing is, the manager is walking around. SMH

At the end of the day, it's a Chili's, but it's location makes it a great place to meet before heading into the adjacent movie theatre.  The bar staff is overworked at prime-time, but still relatively attentative, and the "always happy hour" 2 for 1 deals means the beer will be less than a soda when you head to the movies preceding them.

When on Long Island, sometimes I crave chain restaurants that I don't usually eat at while in the city. Chili's is cheap and they have strong drinks and lots of cheesy junk food. The wait kind of sucks at this location since the movie theater is right over there. But you can't beat cheap, strong, big margaritas, cheese fries or nachos and chicken crispers or fajitas. Although the next day I usually feel the need to kick my workout into high gear.

Ok, this guy is partial to this place.  Maybe more than partial.  I've been going to this Chili's since before I could drink legally, dated a waitress, and used the take-out parking space as my own.  I could navigate to the bathroom blindfolded and spun in circles by an angry midget blowing an air horn in my ear. However, it is the consistently excellent food and 2-for-1's that keep bringing me back.
It's nothing special,  but their 2 for $35 deal which includes a 3 course meal and 2 margaritas is worth it.

Came here last night with two friends. I believe the waitress didn't give us the receipt back after we paid because she was afraid I would take the survey and let everyone know how horrible the service was.  We sat down and was approached by a woman who was currently training. Don't remember her name. She said there were also two gentleman who would be helping out. Throughout the night not one ever came up to us to let us know they were helping out. First off the waitress had no knowledge about the beers. I asked her if she had pumpkin and she had no clue. She also told us incorrect beers that were include in the specials. I decided to just get an Iced Tea. I had a coupon for a free appetizer or dessert. We showed the waitress and ordered the Texas cheese fries as well as our entrees.  After that there was a leak starting above our table. I felt as if I was taking a shower. The hostess moved us to a different table and she was very nice. We waited a while for our food. When it finally came out, the entrees came out before the Texas fries. We weren't happy. The manager came over quickly after that with our fries. She dropped them on the table and said I'm sorry about that these are on us. She also got us refills. Well obviously the fries are on you we had a coupon so that really did nothing for us. She never told us her name of anything or ever come back to check up on us. Honestly nobody checked up on us after that for about 10 minutes to see how our food came out or if we needed anything. We had empty cups that sat on our table for most of the night. Horrible pre-busing.  The table across from us remained dirty for about 25 minutes. Not something we want to be staring at while we eat our dinner. The food was actually good though but that was defiantly the only positive. I got a to-go box for my food. Got our check then didn't see our waitress again for a while. Had to ask another gentlemen to find her for us so we can pay. He said he would take care of it for us which was the correct thing to do. We sat very close to the POS system where everyone was standing including the manager so I honestly think we should have been checked up on sooner and there should be no reason our table should be dirty. We all work at a restaurant down the street from this location. I am a manager, the other two friends I was with were a server and a cook. We were very disappointed with the service and our overall time at the restaurant. If this doesn't improve Joes Crab Shack opening next to you will steal a lot of your business. I know they will get mine as I don't plan on returning.
Fajitas were good and the place is friendly but nothing beats authentic cooking. However, this place isn't bad and the service was good.

Friendly service, especially the wait staff at the tables. The food wasn't good. The cheese fries were mushy and tasteless. The massed potatoes was super salty. The BBQ ribs was small, with little meat, and dry. The only decent thing I tried was the flatbread.

At least once a month I go to this Chili's.  The wait staff are very good, most of them, and the food comes out in a timely manner.   I have never had the food be bad quality.  I have been going to chili's over the years and it is still a good restaurant.  I definitely recommend going there for any lunch or dinner.

I will not be going back to Chili's again. My wife and I have avoided Chili's because we didn't see too much in the way of food for vegetarians. In 2012 that is actually bad business.  We received a gift card for the holidays for Chili's and on a whim we decided, hey, let's give it a chance. We ordered drinks and appetizers while we tried to scour the menu for something we could MAKE vegetarian even if they didn't have the courtesy to give us good choices. We are pretty adept at doing this (as a few places we have gone to haven't caught up with the times yet) so this was not unusual. We got our appetizers and main at the same time. Not quite what we wanted to do. What we did choose for a main took a lot of creativity and settling as even trying to find something we could switch to vegetarian took some doing.  We ordered a white zinfandel and I'm not sure what company it came from, but it did not tast good. Dessert was good however. We had a chocolate cake with 2 scoops of ice cream.  Now I probably would have given the experience 3 stars even though we did not get what we wanted, however here's what ruined my night and as days have gone by have made me angry. We had a gift card for 50.00. The bill was 42.00. Here is what the waiter did when he got the gift card. He took it and said thank you and began to walk away. We were surprised and kind of looked at him. He, acknowledging our surprise said it again and left. So we lost $8.00 on this deal. He did not offer us a credit for the difference, he did not acknowledge the difference in the bill, he just left.  Both my wife and I were annoyed by this. This is where the restaurant lost the other two stars. Chili's need to do a better job with things like this. They need to join the 2012 list of businesses like Red Robin and California Pizza kitchen that offer vegetarian alternatives and actual vegetarian meals. Their commercials make you want to go to the place. One visit.....Cured.

If you just stick with the basics, you'll be okay. Usually, this is true but I had a tequila chicken dish that was pretty good for a chain restaurant and the my brother had some other mexican style dish and we were both pretty happy. It's a good place to go if you need food before or after a movie because you can walk to the theatre (Westbury Raceway Theatre is right there).  I liked it but the staff was a little inattentive because I was actually hoping for a refill on my coke but no such luck and we had to catch our movie so my thirst was left unquenched.  I will go back to try the ribs that everyone seems to love...except that guy Scott. I love ribs so this will be a good little test.

For a cheap pretty good meal Chili's is a fine place to go.  The 2-for-1 margaritas are tasty although they never seem to have enough booze in them.  The biggest downside of this place is the crazy wait on a Friday or Saturday night.  At Chili's you know what you are going to get and that's why people choose it.

okay all the whiners below my review. it's CHILI'S!! if you want some high class restaurant this is not the place for you. now I love high class expensive restaurants but if I ate there all the time we'd have no money! so for lunch some days or just one of those nights we don't want to go nuts me and my friends or me and my boyfriend go to Chilis. they have the $20 deal and the food is yummy. it's not 5 star restaurant yummy but it is yummy. anyone complaining just go somewhere else jesus. it's not the place for you. of course the food is not always amazing and sometimes I'm like what did they do? but that's anywhere you go. all places have an off night they can't be perfect and delicious every time. only complaint about Chilis is they close too early. stay open like applebees does! it sucks when we want to go out late and besides applebees all we have is diners at only 11 pm. long island isn't NYC but some places can stay open an extra hour until 1 am for those who work late and want actual food! this goes for all restaurants in the area besides applebees too. an extra hour will not kill you!
When you get a good waiter/waitress it really makes a difference here. I have no idea why they removed Mozzarella sticks off the menu.. should be standard in a chain like this.
They have great twofers (if that's how you spell it).  Good salads, but I rather have Houlihans, Applebees, or Fridays.
