Normally I wouldnt have a problem but the last time i went there, we called ahead and still waited 10 min...ok, we also waited 15 min for the server to come over, at a dirty table, another 45 min for food, and our table was under the ac. We ended up goin to the bar for drinks before we got seated, when we got there she asked me if i wanted a drink and then left, forgetting the other 4 ppl at the table ! Our food got cold so fast and the drinks were running out quick. It is the only place that has "presidentes" which i love and molten lava cake, but come on i used to serve tables and this was the worst!

This should be a ZERO but you know Yelp rules there has to be something there.  I ordered the fried steak which was disgusting but I admit my hand in that mistake of trying something a little adventurous instead of the norm. The next time I came back here I got the ribs and they were horrible!!! HOW CAN THEY NOT DO THIS RIGHT???? They have all those damn commericals and freakin' Mike Myers singing about them and they sucked!! They were dry and had very little meat on them and the sauce was like ketchup! Don't give this place your business it's horrible.

What a shit hole...excuse my French...but we sat down and the table was filthy. I look next to me at the other tables that were empty and they had crumbs on them. The floor had straw wrappers and food. It looked like we came in after an afternoon food fight. We were pissed that we decided to even come into a Chili's...but now felt pretty stupid sitting in this dirty dive waiting for a waitress. Eventually she came...we decided to order an appetizer and drinks and then get dinner somewhere else. Awful food, bad service and just a really low class fast food joint in a pretty nice area on the Island.
Suprized by the low rating everytime I come to this restaurant I have a pleasant experience

I LOVE THIS place. Not authentic Mexican food, but American Mexican food but very well cooked. Never had any complaints here. Service is always good, and food is always consistently good which keeps me coming back.
definitely chilly up in chili's- had the ac blasting esp at night. ok food, good service, great deals.

Came here early Sunday afternoon for lunch. Place was pretty empty so we were seated right away. That was the only good thing about our visit. The appetizer was served without any plates. We waited about 45 minutes for our entrees. When it finally came one of them was lukewarm. Service was extremely poor and close to non-existent. I have no idea why we barely saw our waitress, since only a handful of tables were occupied.

Under the Yoda-like, visionary leadership of Anthony, this fine eating establishment nourishes the youth...and the aged, of the United States of America. It combines a certain perky insouciance with the brooding intensity of Mahler in the legendary tradition that only an artist such as the iconic Anthony alone brings to the table. Long may he reign on high! Anthony, may the force continue to be with you!

One of my favorite places to eat at ... i love to start off with the triple appetizer platter i usually get the egg rolls , burger bites and the best SPINACH AND ARTICHOKE DIP simply the best !!! the drinks are delicious ... mojito and margaritas yum yum :)

I was excited to come here for dinner until... There is a special going on for dinner. Two entrees and 1 appetizer for $20.00. It is a good deal. We started of with the Texas style cheese fries. When we got it, it was lukewarm and the cheese was already hardened. Oh why is it like this??  Another thing, the metal fork they have was so sharp, I accidentally bit on the fork with my fries on it and literally the edge of my bottom tooth was chipped. By that time, I didn't want to eat anymore... My friend had the cajun chicken pasta and I had the sante fe sizzling platter. I do not recommend the sante fe dish. It looked really tasty on the menu. Mind you, you get 3 pieces of soft wrapper with cheese inside and chicken on top with that green sauce over onion. Ugh..yea it was really heavy. Pasta was alright and a bit dry.   My poor tooth.. sigh..

The service was horrible luckily for them I wasn't paying..I wouldn't leave any tip...sat there for roughly 15 minutes before we were attended to after speaking with another waiter ...took about 8mins to get water, we waited about another 25 mins for food and when it was served they were all cold... Love chili's elsewhere... but I will never ever visit this location ever again...Horrible horrible service

location: Town of North Hempstead, Long Island, NY
review: ROACHES. ROACHES. Went out hoping for a pleasant first experience at chilis, it was the most disgusting place I've been to. Sticky dirty menus, the waitress disappeared for 15 minutes, and THERE WERE ROACHES. We ordered and then saw them, ran out so fast. It was the most horrendous experience I've ever had. Do not eat here, this chilis needs to be reported to the board of health.

Don't know why but I felt the need to give Chili's a visit. On bright side the service was great, the food however, standard.  Chain restaurants just always fail in comparison to mom and pop places. Beef fajitas weren't that bad.

When out with some friends and my son. The wait wasn't that bad for a Sunday afternoon. The waiter Christine was friendly and made suggestions. I asked how spicy was the mango tilapia and she said not at all. It was very spicy. I rarely eat spicy food so I felt the heat quick. The meal overall was ok. My son wasn't into his cheeseburger meal and he usually is a good eater. My friend ordered the cajun chicken pasta. She ordered the cajun on the side and never used it because she felt it was good without it. Her brother ordered the fajita trio and wasn't too thrilled about the consistency of the tortillas. Overall maybe would come back but maybe try more of an american plate.

This place has gone down hill. It was so dirty and we were not impressed with the service. We ordered appetizers and we didn't get any plates. When we requested some plates they were wet and left right on the table for us to dry! Food was, but maybe that's because we were starving. Good luck

Sticky. I need no other words to describe my experience. My menu was sticky, my table was sticky. EWWWWWWWWWWWWWW. There is nothing worse to me....it was 11:45 am! How can your place be so gross that early?  My grilled chicken sandwich was whatever. It's cheap. You get what you pay for.

I've been going to this Chilis location many times over the years and find it consistently good. They have very good appetizers and good entrees and the bar always has great deals. For a chain it is definetely at the high end IMO.

My first visit. Got the appetizers in time.  But the meals took around 40 minutes to serve. As I was with family members and a holiday lunch,  it didn't bother us.  We enjoyed the food and service (except  the delay for the main course)

Nice place to go for dinner. I've only ever been here on Friday nights, and the wait is long. You might be waiting close to an hour but they serve fun, inexpensive food that's worth the wait. If you're in the area at a time that is not a weekend night it'll probably much more empty but whatever time you're around I suggest that you check it out. Fun times!
out of all chain restaurants in the area i will definitely go to chilis!  margaritas and cheesesteak sliders! paradise pie and a delicious brownie sundae as well.

I go to this Chili's frequently.  I like the new setup at the bar.  I signed up online and now I receive coupons for free apps or deserts.  I usually go after anything on the "lite" menu.  I appreciate that they always accommodate my food substitution requests!  Usually don't drink when I go, but I've had some margaritas there.  I'm going to be a snob, but I can't give a chain restaurant 5 stars.  If I go to another Chili's, I'm going to expect the exact same everything and that's not right.  So for now, the Chili's is Westbury is tops!

This place is hit or miss, we got here early to avoid the insanely long wait. I like the pomegranate margarita and the bottom less salsa/ chips appetizer. The chips come out warm and have the perfect amount of salt. This time I tried the Chicken soft tacos, very good I'll definitely order them again. Our server lacked personality and ambition, probably the fact we were a party of 8 and the tip was automatically added on; however if he built his check it would have benefitted him greatly

Always a good, inexpensive bite to eat. This chili's is always cold but if your old enough to drink that helps lol. If you ask them to turn it down they say they will but who knows if they really do. Their ribs and steak are decent and the burgers are filling. Overall, they've got my vote
Nice staff. Love their monterey chicken. I wonder what animal is seen on one if their murals though. Looks like an armadillo.

The nd and I went out shopping and worked up an appetite. We decided on chili's because it was 2 for $20.  We didn't like the appetizer choice so that idea went out the window. From the time we walked in it was good times. The hostess was great. Our server Jean or jl was awesome. Made us feel very the welcomed. We got the spinach and artichoke dip. It was hot, fresh and tasty. I ordered the Avocado burger, it was good. The bf had the triple sampler. He got the fiesta rolls, yum, the boneless buffalo wings and the big mouth sliders. He enjoyed that with his 2fer beer. All in all it was a good date night. Even for a Monday.

Good happy hour, crap restaurant. The bar gets to hopping here on Friday's after work.  Other than that you should avoid it like the plague. The food is standard chain grub- nothing more, nothing less.  The patrons are usually mobbed at the door trying to get a table, by 7pm the place looks like a battlefield. Repeat: Happy hour at the bar only.
